newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Cheung Kong related firm in US$712mln loan.
newsitem.headline: Cheung Kong related firm in US$712mln loan.

text.p: A Singapore-based investment holding company held by firms associated with Hong Kong tycoon Li Ka-Shing is seeking a US$712 million loan, coordinating arranger and bookrunner CIBC CEF Singapore said on Tuesday.
The company, Japura PLC, is 52 percent owned by Li Ka-shing, 24 percent owned by Cheung Kong (Holdings) and 24 percent owned by Hutchison Whampoa Ltd.
Li is chairman of both Cheung Kong and Hutchison Whampoa.
Proceeds of the facility, Japura's first borrowing, will be used for general working capital, the arranger said.
The US$712 million dual facility loan is divided into two tranches.
Tranche A of US$341.76 million is severally guaranteed by Cheung Kong and Hutchison Whampoa.
Tranche B of US$370.24 million is guaranteed by Li Ka-shing.
Tranche A will be syndicated, while tranche B will be underwritten on a take and hold basis by CIBC CEF Singapore.
Both Tranche A and tranche B are further split into two parts.
Tranche A1 is a US$240 term loan. A2 is a US$101.76 million revolving credit. Tranche B1 is a US$260 million term loan and B2 is a US$110.24 million revolving credit.
A1 and B1, the term loan portions of the facility, are available for drawdown for one month. A2 and B2, the revolving credits, are available for drawdown for 45 months.
All tranches have a final maturity of four years with bullet repayment and pay a margin of 43 basis points over the Singapore Interbank Offered Rate.

Arrangers committing US$45 million receive a commitment fee of 32 basis points and an underwriting fee of seven basis points, while co-arrangers committing US$30 million receive a commitment fee of 32 basis points and an underwriting fee of five basis points.

Fees are 32 basis points for lead managers committing US$15-20 million, 27 basis points for co-lead managers committing US$10-14.9 million and 24 basis points for managers committing US$5-9.9 million.
